results.content: I am enjoying the course, and have learned a lot about, not only Javascript, but also object-oriented programming.  The only complaint I have, is the lack of consistency when it came to the examples section - the instructor coded a little differently then he had done in the previous lessons.
results.content_html: I am enjoying the course, and have learned a lot about, not only Javascript, but also object-oriented programming. The only complaint I have, is the lack of consistency when it came to the examples section - the instructor coded a little differently then he had done in the previous lessons.

results.content: Great Experience

Solid course teaching the fundamental foundation of Javascript Programming. I would have liked to have seen more practical uses. There are a couple of good exercises with the progress loading bar and color changing tutorial sections. 
The course instructors accent is fairly strong, and it is warned at the beginning. This did not take away from the knowledge the instructor was sharing.
results.content_html:
Solid course teaching the fundamental foundation of Javascript Programming. I would have liked to have seen more practical uses. There are a couple of good exercises with the progress loading bar and color changing tutorial sections.
The course instructors accent is fairly strong, and it is warned at the beginning. This did not take away from the knowledge the instructor was sharing.

results.content: So far, the course delivers what I have expected. Solid and plain explanations that are easy to follow.

results.content: more like a crash course for JS for beginners with enough details in the lectures and lecture material to finish the course in merely an hour with side by side practice.
results.content_html: more like a crash course for JS for beginners with enough details in the lectures and lecture material to finish the course in merely an hour with side by side practice.

results.content:
After avoiding JavaScript like the plaque for the longest time, I finally had my lightbulb moment during this course. It is hands down the simplest JS tutorial I've come across and would highly recommend it to anyone looking to cement down the basics. 

The stand-alone lessons all start from an empty solution and are easy to code along to. I liked the short duration of the videos and the way the content is split up into bite-size sections. 

In terms of feedback for the instructor I have 3 comments:

Firstly I noticed inconsistencies in the syntax, especially the use of spaces, capitalization, and semicolons. The code runs fine, but for a beginner level student, it can be beneficial to get used to a standard way of doing things. 

Secondly, my interest calculator in lesson 41 required event.preventDefault() to work. This isn't covered in the lesson and can cause much frustration.

And lastly, lesson 31 on the pop method could have been demonstrated better - I felt that this was briefed over without a good practical example. 

Please accept my feedback as constructive as this is seriously an awesome course. I learned loads and look forward to getting my hands dirty with practical JS.
results.content_html:
After avoiding JavaScript like the plaque for the longest time, I finally had my lightbulb moment during this course. It is hands down the simplest JS tutorial I've come across and would highly recommend it to anyone looking to cement down the basics.

The stand-alone lessons all start from an empty solution and are easy to code along to. I liked the short duration of the videos and the way the content is split up into bite-size sections.

In terms of feedback for the instructor I have 3 comments:

Firstly I noticed inconsistencies in the syntax, especially the use of spaces, capitalization, and semicolons. The code runs fine, but for a beginner level student, it can be beneficial to get used to a standard way of doing things.

Secondly, my interest calculator in lesson 41 required event.preventDefault() to work. This isn't covered in the lesson and can cause much frustration.

And lastly, lesson 31 on the pop method could have been demonstrated better - I felt that this was briefed over without a good practical example.

Please accept my feedback as constructive as this is seriously an awesome course. I learned loads and look forward to getting my hands dirty with practical JS.
